intro: Isodon barbeyanus, commonly known as the African germander, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink or purple and are arranged in whorled clusters. Isodon barbeyanus is often used in traditional medicine for its purported antiseptic and anti-inflammatory properties.
